pros: Close to home for Brunswick Co residents
cons: Small hospital; you may "wear many hats."

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Southport, NC
pros: Your able to make your own hours.

review_title: Great Office but Hospital Management not so much
job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Oak Island, NC
pros: Great co workers in the office, benefits and pay was good. Work at the ocean is always a plus
cons: Hospital Management of their offices got worse once they hired a Micro Manager who threaten your position often

job_title: Senior Executive Assistant in Southport, NC
pros: Close to home, had some great board members
cons: Senior leadership was terrible - the CNO ruled by fear and intimidation with her group of minions. If you got on her bad side, she did her best to make your life miserable and her cronies went out of their way to do the same.

pros: Providing a service to the community. Building my nursing skills in a bare bones hospital with very limited resources and capabilities.
cons: Extremely gossipy/cliquish relationship among several members of management and select nurses-- several have been fired simply because they were not part of the "in crowd" -- very middle schoolish atmosphere in the workplace among adults. Shockingly disappointing. Only $20 and change for an RN on night shift WITH EXPERIENCE. Totally do not recommend unless this is your very last option on the planet and you are facing eviction and homelessness unless you can pay your bills.

pros: Patient Care Unit is attractive and clean
cons: Management is terribly partial to some employees,  rules and disciplinary action apply only to some employees.  Constant negative feedback, unsafe working conditions and night, as no onsite on call physician. Very stressful if patient ztarts to decline clinically,  management does NOT step in to help.

pros: Love my office coworkers, and patients
cons: No room to move up within company, very base pay

pros: Decent work life balance.  Small town private hospital.
cons: Administration needs improvement. "Good ol boys club".

Management needs to change from the bottom up. Decisions are not made with patient or staff safety in mind. 

Pay is low.
management, board, good old boy network
